Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: STRING IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying a production string withina well.
Column Comment.3: WELL STRING FORMATION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequential observationnumber used to uniquely identify each completed (perforated) formation (layer) that iscontributing production to a well string.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: ALLOCATION FACTOR: A factor that is used in calculations to allocate productionfrom one entity to another.
Column Comment.6: ALLOCATION FACTOR TYPE: The type of allocation factor that is used incalculations to attribute (allocate) a measured movement of fluid to a number ofproduction entities.
Column Comment.7: BASE DEPTH: The base of the formation (layer) that is contributing production to awell string.
Column Comment.8: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.9: COMPLETION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequential observation number used touniquely identify each completed (perforated) interval.
Column Comment.10: WELL STATUS: Identifies defines the status of the well. For example: cased,spudded, licensed, dry, abandoned oil, gas, ...
Column Comment.11: CURRENT STATUS DATE: Date of the current status.
Column Comment.12: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.13: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.14: POOL IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a pool, often based on geologic definitions.Usually, these pool definitions are created based on stratigraphic and geologic data.Geologic pools represent stratigraphic formations that contain connected reservoirsof hydrocarbons (can be based on the same pressure gradient, for example). EachPROD_STRING_FORM will be associated with one geologic pool.
Column Comment.15: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.16: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.17: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.18: STATUS TYPE: The type of status reported for the well. Can include constructionstatus, operating status, producing status, abandonment status etc.
Column Comment.19: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.20: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.21: TOP DEPTH: The top of the formation (layer) that is contributing production to a wellstring.
Column Comment.22: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.24: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.26: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.29: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
